Houseplant Care

makes plant noises

Introduction

As it turns out, I actually enjoy taking care of houseplants. Sure it's not the most involved of hobbies, but there's something really satisfying about checking up on your plants everyday and seeing them grow. Plus giving them names and taking care of them makes them feel like extremely low maintenance pets, which just adds to their appeal.


This page will be dedicated to showing off my steadily growing plant collection, and tracking how my plants change over time.

The Plant Gang

Meet the Gang!

Benjamin

Crassula Ovata?

Benjamin was my first plant, that I got after an awful trip to Ikea. He's still small, but he's really improved from when I got him (and from that two month period where I accidentally underwatered him).

Benju

Crassula Ovata?

Benju (or Benjamin Junior) was this random cutting I found in Benjamin's pot. He may or may not be dead.

Tyler

Aeonium Haworthii?

Tyler was my second plant, that I got from a farmers market. He used to be kept in my room, but after he was caught harboring a praying mantis I banished him to decking (along with all the other plants).

Jamie

Crassula Rupestris?

Jamie was a Christmas gift from my sister, and I have no idea how they're progressing. What I can safely say is that they're either doing better or worse from when I got them.

Steven

Callisia Repens?

Steven was also a Christmas gift from my sister, so Jamie and him are essentially siblings. Steven was named after Steven Universe, because you know, they're both pink. I know, I'm a creative genius, no need to praise me.

Izzy

Crassula Arborescens?

I found Izzy in the backyard in the bowl she's currently in, except there were only rocks and no soil inside it. After replanting her, I think she's starting to do ok again, although I have no idea how to check if that's true.

Theo

Crassula Ovata?

Theo was in the same bowl as Izzy, but he was put in one of my sisters pottery attempts instead. I think he's actually doing quite well, he's definitely less shriveled than when I found him.

Penny

Portulacaria Afra?

Penny actually belongs to my parents, and was outside our house for years before I repotted her. Apparently you put this type of plant at the front of your door, and it brings the house money (which is why I named her Penny). Of course no one watered it for years, so she's not doing so hot right now.
